meanings.definition: To cut short or cut off the tail of something.
meanings.sent1: The gardener was bobtailing the bushes to make them look neat.
meanings.sent2: She carefully bobtailed the rope to the desired length.
meanings.sent3: The tailor accidentally bobtailed the dress, making it too short.
meanings.sent4: The editor had to bobtail the article to fit the space available.
meanings.sent5: Bobtailing the story made it more concise and impactful.

meanings.definition: A truck or vehicle that is operating without a trailer attached.
meanings.sent1: The bobtailing truck zoomed down the highway with ease.
meanings.sent2: The company used bobtailing to transport goods efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The bobtailing vehicle looked odd without its trailer attached.
meanings.sent4: The bobtailing truck felt lighter and more agile on the road.
meanings.sent5: Bobtailing saved fuel by reducing the weight of the vehicle.
